titleStmt.title: The character of the Protestants of Ireland impartially set forth in a letter, in answer to seven queries ... : with remarks upon the great charge England is like to be at with those people, and the destruction of that kingdom by famine, if not prevented.
titleStmt.author: Halifax, George Savile, Marquis of, 1633-1695.

titleStmt.title: The character of the Protestants of Ireland impartially set forth in a letter, in answer to seven queries ... : with remarks upon the great charge England is like to be at with those people, and the destruction of that kingdom by famine, if not prevented.

notesStmt.note: Attributed to George Halifax. Cf. Halkett & Laing (2nd ed.).
